document_data.caption: [[Teldin Moore]] and the half-[[kender]] [[Gaeadrelle Goldring|Gaye]] battle [[scro]] boarders on the deck of the [[Gnome|gnomish]] [[spelljammer]] ''[[Perilous Halibut]]''.
document_data.title: The Maelstrom's Eye
document_data.author: [[Roger E. Moore]]
document_data.realm year: [[1361 DR|1361]] or [[1362 DR]]{{The Maelstrom's Eye date}}
document_data.edition1: <!-- leave blank if there is only one -->
document_data.mainbody:
'''''The Maelstrom's Eye''''' by [[Roger E. Moore]] is book three in the [[Cloakmaster Cycle]], a six-book series for the [[Spelljammer: AD&D Adventures in Space|Spelljammer]] campaign setting. It begins on the [[Rock of Bral]].

{{Quote|From an [[Elf|elven]] admiral at the [[Rock of Bral]], [[Teldin Moore]] learns more about [[Cloak of the First Pilot|his cloak's]] past and its potential powers—but he doesn't count on being caught up in the hurricane of the [[second Unhuman War]]. Vengeful [[humanoid]]s rampage through the Known [[crystal sphere|Spheres]], and they're on Teldin's trail even as he hunts for the ultimate spacefaring ship of all: the mighty [[Spelljammer (spelljammer)|''Spelljammer'']]!}}
document_data.Synopsis: The ''[[Probe]]'', now captained by [[Teldin Moore]]'s friend [[Aelfred Silverhorn]], docks at the [[Rock of Bral]] so that Teldin can follow a lead given him by the [[wizard]] [[Vallus Leafbower]] regarding his [[Cloak of the First Pilot|magic cloak]]. Vallus had suggested he visit the [[elves]] of [[Evermeet]], but Teldin thought that visiting the [[Elven Embassy (Bral)|elven embassy]] of [[Bral]] would suffice. On his way, he passes through the [[Greater Market]] of Bral and runs into an exuberant young girl named [[Gaeadrelle Goldring|Gaye]], who convinces him to visit a tavern to try some chicken cooked by [[halfling]]s. After the meal, Teldin is shocked to learn that Gaye is a [[kender]] and finds a way to excuse himself and enter the [[Elven Forest (Bral)|Elven Forest]].
